title: Carti Project
description: This is a project I made shortly after the relase of the highly anticipated 'MUSIC' by Playboi Carti. It is a lyric video for his track 'Olympian'. I merged multiple of his pre-existing music videos to form a base and then went off working on the typography.

title: Asfalt Texture
description: Asfalt was my final project of my second year of studies. The brief was extremely vague, so it left us completely free in terms of conception and execution, the only demand was to create a typographic specimen in a physical format. At the time, I had taken a major inspiration in anti-design work. I was especially interested in super condensed and stretched fonts. While in my research I came across this typeface which blew me away the second I saw it.  This visual makes reference to the Vietnam war that was currently going on. Many of the soldiers of colour who fought had their homes torn down while they were away. It was exactly what I was looking for, and on top of that it was a variable typeface. This gave me even more creative liberty to play around with it. The typeface was originally drawn by Dinamo Type being based off of road markings. As I’m sure you’ve noticed, road markings when seen from a top down angle appear extremely stretched as they are meant to be viewed from the perspective of a driver. Conceptually I wanted to stay on this idea of the road, and so I created a 4 meter long leporello that talked about the history of racism and highways in the United States. The story all starts with the initial conception of the highway system at the 1939 New York World Fair. The construction of highways throughout cities almost always resulted in some sort of black or brown community being ran through or completely torn down. Throughout the specimen I cover some of the people who created this racist system that still affects POC’s today, as well as the people who fought to stop it. Each of my visuals present the typography while essentially ‘driving’ down this history of racism in the highway system. I use the word history very liberally here though, as later in the leporello I cover extremely recent events proving that this infrastructural segregation is still well and alive today. Visually I took reference from two main sources of inspiration. The first is the signage that one can often see while driving down the highway. The second was inspiration taken from the different protest signs and slogans that people had up during marches against these highways.

title: Frank Texture
description: A painterly material study named 'Frank', designed for stylized 3D projects.

title: Hollis Project
description: Motion design project for Hollis, blending typography and fluid animation.

title: Wizard of Oz
description: A studio shoot where the concept was to mix the 'Wizard of Oz' with modern fashion. I directed the entire set and costume design.

title: HUGO
description: A project based around branding a new publishing company. We decided to go with a horror theme which I wanted to push as much as I could in the logo. For the business cards I wanted to try something a little more experimental than the regular layout so I decided to play around with the rotation and position on it.

title: Kendrick Project
description: A video art project inspired by Kendrick Lamar's discography and visual identity.
